Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility to Canada due to criminality
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Equivalency assessment of foreign conviction under Canadian law
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s.36(2)(b)
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Comparison of essential elements of Turkish and Canadian assault laws
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate unreasonableness of officer's decision
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Turkish court's rejection of self-defence claim
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Equivalence determined by comparing essential elements of offences, not general legal principles
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Assessment of procedural fairness in immigration decision-making
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged incorrect equivalency assessment between Turkish and Canadian laws
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No breach found in decision-making process
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Turkish conviction under Article 86 for felonious injury
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration law and administrative law principles
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to equivalency determination based on self-defence argument
Crimes.Court_Result: Dismissal of application for judicial review
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: IRPA s.36(2)(b), case law on equivalency assessment
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities in administrative context
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Self-defence raised but rejected by Turkish court
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Judicial review of immigration officer’s decision
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Criminal conviction equivalent to indictable offence in Canada
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Permanent residence application with admissibility screening

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Immigration inadmissibility based on criminal conviction
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Claim of self-defence (rejected by Turkish court)
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient based on official conviction record
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Presumed valid unless proven otherwise; accepted as authentic
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Turkish court did not accept self-defence, supporting conviction validity
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Potential risk to public safety due to violent offence
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Incident occurred abroad, assessed in Canadian immigration context
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Federal Court of Canada (reviewing foreign conduct)
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Canadian criminal law
Crimes.Applicable_Statute: Criminal Code of Canada, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Finding of equivalence between Turkish and Canadian assault laws
Crimes.Outcome: Inadmissibility confirmed due to criminal conviction
Crimes.Sentencing_Issue: Not applicable – focus on conviction, not sentence
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Correct application of equivalency test during immigration assessment
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review of immigration officer's decision
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Administrative decision-making followed by judicial review
